abstract: Mr. McCoy transformed the smallest bank in Columbus, Ohio, into a national powerhouse.
snippet: Mr. McCoy transformed the smallest bank in Columbus, Ohio, into a national powerhouse.
lead_paragraph: John G. McCoy, who transformed the smallest bank in Columbus, Ohio, into the national powerhouse Banc One, died Sunday at his home in New Albany, Ohio. He was 97.

headline.main: John G. McCoy, Innovator in Banking, Dies at 97
headline.print_headline: John G. McCoy, Innovator In Banking, Dies at 97

abstract: Mary Callahan Erdoes, who heads up JPMorgan Chase’s $1.7 trillion asset management unit, has her eye on bulking up on private equity, Financial News reported.
snippet: Mary Callahan Erdoes, who heads up JPMorgan Chase’s $1.7 trillion asset management unit, has her eye on bulking up on private equity, Financial News reported.
lead_paragraph: Mary Callahan Erdoes, who heads up JPMorgan Chase‘s $1.7 trillion asset management unit, has her eye on bulking up on private equity, Financial News reported.

headline.main: JPMorgan Asset Management Chief Eyes P.E.

abstract: While its rivals have spent much of the past year regaining market share lost during the financial crisis, JPMorgan Chase sat atop Dealogic’s investment banking league tables for the first quarter of 2010. (It slipped in mergers advisory, however.)
snippet: While its rivals have spent much of the past year regaining market share lost during the financial crisis, JPMorgan Chase sat atop Dealogic’s investment banking league tables for the first quarter of 2010. (It slipped in mergers advisory, however....
lead_paragraph: While its rivals have spent much of the past year regaining market share lost during the financial crisis, JPMorgan Chase sat atop Dealogic’s investment banking league tables for the first quarter of 2010.

headline.main: JPMorgan Keeps Lead in I-Banking League Tables
